author: @yeetdeets
text: You should use playonlinux for any Windows software on Linux. It creates a virtual drive with all the windows stuff you need, which survives reinstalls of the Linux OS as well. Some stuff defaults to french, but in my experience it's the easiest way by far, having used Lutris and manual Wine before.
